item.title: DPR Korea launches ‘unprecedented number’ of missiles, Security Council hears
item.description: The Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) launched “an unprecedented number” of cruise and ballistic missiles over the course of just 48 hours this week, the UN Assistant Secretary-General for the Middle East, Asia and the Pacific, told the Security Council in an emergency meeting on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Sweden: Step up efforts to fight systemic racism, urge UN experts
item.description: Sweden should step up efforts to fight systemic racism and focus on strategies to restore trust between police and minority groups, said a UN Human Rights Council-appointed group of independent experts on advancing racial justice and equality, on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Safety and security of Yemeni civilians at risk unless truce is extended, says human rights chief
item.description: Warring factions in Yemen are being urged to extend a UN-mediated truce following reports of deaths and injuries of civilians from sniper attacks and shelling. The truce, which started at the beginning of April, ended more than a month ago, and human rights chief, Volker Türk, says that there is grave and growing concern for the safety and security of civilians.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Persons affected by leprosy excluded from conversations around disability: rights expert
item.description: People affected by leprosy should be fully recognized as persons with disabilities, both at the national and global levels, a UN independent human rights expert said on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Climate change much deadlier than cancer in some places, UNDP data shows
item.description: The impact of climate change on health if carbon emissions remain high, could be up to twice as deadly as cancer in some parts of the world, according to new data released on Friday by the UN Development Programme (UNDP) and the Climate Impact Lab.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN refugee chief urges stronger action to end ‘legal limbo’ of statelessness
item.description: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Filippo Grandi, on Friday called for stronger political commitment and action to improve the lives of the roughly 4.3 million stateless people worldwide who are “languishing without citizenship and living in the shadows.”
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Resurgence of ethnic clashes in Sudan’s Blue Nile region triggers death and destruction
item.description: The UN Special Adviser on the Prevention of Genocide expressed grave concern on Thursday over a reported resurgence of ethnic clashes in the Blue Nile region of Sudan.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Haiti ‘on the verge of an abyss’, warns UN rights chief
item.description: Amid continuing gang warfare and a vacuum of law and order, Haiti is “on the verge of an abyss” said the UN human rights chief Volker Türk on Thursday, warning that any hope of a sustainable recovery requires “urgent and sustained action” to tackle the root causes of the overlapping crises afflicting the island nation.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: New UN course helps cut through the noise to bolster online safety
item.description: The UN on Thursday launched a new online course that provides wikiHow platform users with vital tips on how to stay safe from the dangerous disinformation, that is increasingly populating social media platforms.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN chief urges Security Council, speak ‘with one voice’ to secure peace
item.description: UN peace operations, which include peacekeeping and special political missions, “provide the space for political solutions” in some of the world’s most complex hotspots, Secretary-General António Guterres told the Security Council on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Iconic World Heritage glaciers to disappear by 2050, warns UNESCO
item.description: Some of the world’s most iconic glaciers are set to disappear by 2050, according to a new study by UNESCO, which highlights the accelerated melting of glaciers in World Heritage sites.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: South Sudan: Conflict and climate crisis drives rising hunger
item.description: The number of people in South Sudan who are going hungry is at the highest level ever, UN agencies said in their latest Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) report, issued on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine grain deal, Ethiopia agreement, show ‘power of multilateralism in action’: Guterres
item.description: Russia’s decision to rejoin the Black Sea Grain Initiative and the Ethiopian agreement to end the war in Tigray demonstrate the power of multilateralism in action, said the UN chief on Thursday, in a call for countries to also rebuild trust between the North and South at the UN’s COP27 climate conference in Egypt.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: More funding needed for climate adaptation, as risks mount
item.description: Countries must urgently ramp up action to adapt to the current and future impacts of climate change, as efforts now are too little and too slow, the UN Environment Programme (UNEP) said in its latest report, published on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ethiopia: Peace agreement between Government and Tigray ‘a critical first step’: Guterres
item.description: A peace deal between the Ethiopian Government and the Tigray People’s Liberation Front (TPLF) signed on Wednesday in South Africa, represents “a critical first step” towards ending the brutal two year war, said the UN chief.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Humanitarians aid thousands in need across DR Congo; UN peacekeepers attacked by hostile crowd
item.description: Despite severe constraints on access, UN and other humanitarian workers in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) have begun helping thousands displaced by renewed fighting between the Congolese army and the M23 armed group around the eastern region of North Kivu, close to the border with Rwanda and Uganda.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN refugee chief calls for greater focus on climate and conflict factors
item.description: Responses to climate change must also consider its link to both conflict and the displacement it causes, UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Filippo Grandi, said in a briefing to the Security Council on Wednesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Intimidated, jailed, abused: Threats against journalists harm us all, warns UN chief
item.description: Governments and the international community must take action to protect the people who bring us the news, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said in his message on the International Day to End Impunity for Crimes Against Journalists, observed on Wednesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Europe hotting up more than twice global average: WMO
item.description: Temperatures in Europe have increased at more than twice the global average over the past 30 years – the highest of any continent in the world. As the warming trend continues, exceptional heat, wildfires, floods and other climate change impacts will affect society, economies and ecosystems, according to a report released Wednesday by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO).
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN chief warmly welcomes Russia decision to end suspension from Ukraine grain deal
item.description: The UN Secretary-General on Wednesday issued a statement warmly welcoming Russia’s decision to resume its participation in the Black Sea Grain Initiative, which has allowed nearly ten million metric tonnes of vital foodstuffs to be shipped from Ukraine.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Human rights belong at the heart of climate change debate, urges Türk
item.description: Humanity’s basic right to life is being threatened by insufficient action in the face of the climate emergency, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk warned on Wednesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Haiti: ‘Triple threat’ of cholera, malnutrition and violence puts young lives at risk
item.description: Immediate action is needed to save young lives in Haiti amid the “triple threat” of cholera, malnutrition and violence, the UN Committee on the Rights of the Child (CRC) said on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Black Sea grain deal shipments on hold Wednesday, following Russia suspension
item.description: UN officials stationed at the Joint Coordination Centre (JCC) for the UN-brokered Black Sea Grain Initiative have said there will be no movement of vessels on Wednesday, in the light of Russia’s decision to suspend its involvement in the deal.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: In speech to Arab League, UN chief appeals for greater regional unity
item.description: Amid growing geopolitical divides and deepening inequalities, cooperation is the only way forward, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said in Algiers on Tuesday, addressing the Summit of the League of Arab States.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: The UN belongs to you, deputy chief tells youth advocates in Spain
item.description: How the UN can better support young people pushing for a more sustainable future for all was among issues discussed during a dialogue between some of the Organization’s senior officials and youth leaders, held in Madrid, Spain, on Monday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Public health risks increasing in flood-affected Pakistan, warns WHO
item.description: Although flood waters have continued to recede in many flood-affected areas across Pakistan in recent weeks, around eight million people need essential health assistance, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Cholera spreading throughout Lebanon, WHO warns
item.description: The first cholera outbreak in nearly three decades in Lebanon is now spreading throughout the country, with more than 1,400 suspected cases, and 17 reported deaths so far, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Afghanistan: Opium cultivation up nearly a third, warns UNODC
item.description: The 2022 opium crop in Afghanistan is the most profitable in years with cultivation up by nearly a third amid soaring prices, and despite the multiple humanitarian and economic crises facing the country and it’s Taliban rulers, said the UN Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Security Council debates Russia's decision to suspend participation in crucial Ukraine grain deal
item.description: The landmark agreement to export grain and related foodstuffs from Ukraine must be kept alive amid the ongoing war and the global cost of living crisis, two senior UN officials told the Security Council on Monday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Progress on methane emissions by energy companies, but numbers still don’t add up: UNEP
item.description: Over 80 oil and gas companies across the world have committed to measuring and reducing their methane emissions, the second biggest driver of global warming, according to a new report by the UN environment agency (UNEP).
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories
